revised_title: Inhibition of Protease-Resistant Prion Protein Accumulation by Congo Red and Sulfated Glycans
tldr: The article discusses the accumulation of protease-resistant prion protein in scrapie-infected cells and how it can be inhibited by Congo red and certain sulfated glycans. These inhibitors may have potential therapeutic applications for transmissible spongiform encephalopathies and other amyloid-related diseases.
